cyber-dojo.sh:
NODE_VERSION=8.4.0

echo JASMINE TESTS
echo =============

n use ${NODE_VERSION} /usr/local/lib/node_modules/jasmine/bin/jasmine \
  JASMINE_CONFIG_PATH=tests/jasmine.json

# You have to cd to a specific folder because
#   ~/node_modules/cucumber/bin/cucumber.js
# contains the line
# require('../lib/cli/run.js').default();
# Go figure!

cd ~/node_modules/cucumber/bin

export NODE_PATH=/home/$CYBER_DOJO_AVATAR_NAME/node_modules

echo CUCUMBER FEATURES
echo =================

./cucumber.js \
  --format-options '{"colorsEnabled":false}' \
  --format-options '{"snippetInterface":"synchronous"}' \
  ${CYBER_DOJO_SANDBOX}/features/*.feature
output:
JASMINE TESTS
=============
Started


No specs found
Finished in 0.004 seconds

CUCUMBER FEATURES
=================
...............

5 scenarios (5 passed)
15 steps (15 passed)
0m00.002s
features/multipleExamples.feature:
Feature: There is a scenario outline with multiple tables
Scenario Outline: Multiple Example tables will run
Given a value <value>
When I multiply it by <factor>
Then the result should be <result>

Examples:
|value|factor|result|
| 5   | 2    | 10   |
| 3   | 3    |  9   |

Examples:
|value|factor|result|
| 15  | 10   | 150|
| 25  | 12   | 300|
| 15  | 8    | 120 |
